name: OWASP Top 10 V2021 Awareness - A6 - A10
description:
OWASP Top 10 Awareness Program

The OWASP Top 10 is a powerful awareness document for web application security. It represents a broad consensus about the most critical security risks to web applications.

The second day of the awareness program includes three sessions covering the risks from 6 to 10 of OWASP top 10 risks and Mitigations,

Location: Online Event, we will have a live streaming for the event through chapter Youtube channel:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOmffRRYZSpYOiJQp15NHQA

Date: 18 Feb 2023

Agenda:

1- A06:2021-Vulnerable and Outdated Components
2- A07:2021-Identification and Authentication Failures
3- A08:2021-Software and Data Integrity Failures
4- A09:2021-Security Logging and Monitoring Failures
5- A10:2021-Server-Side Request Forgery

name: And we're back!
description:
We are BACK folks. Been .. a minute. But we have a great meeting coming together. Jeff Williams is our speaker, and Black Hills Security will be providing the snac. Here's what Jeff will be covering:

After over 20 years, achieving app and API security still requires Herculean effort by smart and dedicated people. Fortunately, we can look to history and see a path forward. In the mid-2000s we changed the curve on kernel exploits by adding ASLR and DEP to operating systems. Imagine hardening your web app and web API stacks against all the major classes of vulnerability. You could instantly notify developers if they introduce a vulnerability and you could stop vulnerable software from being exploited. How would it change your appsec program if you could dramatically reduce the risk of all the common classes of vulnerability? In this talk, we’ll explain how runtime protection works and how you can streamline vulnerability management and ensure your software doesn’t get exploited… at the same time.

name: OWASP July Meet - In person
description:
OWASP Dallas is ready to host in-person meets.

"The Monsters in Your Software Supply Chain that SCA Can't Find"

There are excellent SCA tools and excellent SSDLs out there, so why did the 3cx breach feel so much like GroundHog Day? This talk will discuss root cause, attack vectors, adversaries, and countermeasures for Software Supply Chain Security attacks.

name: Denver OWASP JULY Meetup - Join Us!
description:
**Everyone is welcome! Bring a friend...**

Join us July 26 for food, drinks, networking and an exciting and timely presentation on "Introduction to the OWASP API Security Top 10 2023" from one of the best and brightest in the industry: Alan Shen. Networking with your peers starts at 5 - food is served at 5:30 and the presentation starts at 6.

**Sponsor: A big thank you to our Denver OWASP sponsor [SpyderSec](https://spydersec.com)**

**Presentation Title:** Introduction to the OWASP API Security Top 10 2023

**Presentation Details:** Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) are the glue that allows independently evolving systems to communicate with each other, and are an important focus for security investment due to their privileged access to sensitive data and functionality. Recently, the OWASP API Top 10 has been updated for 2023, so join us as we introduce the OWASP API Security Project. We'll cover what's new in the 2023 API Top 10, as well as compare the differences with the previous 2019 version. For those interested in hands-on practice, we'll also briefly introduce the OWASP crAPI (completely ridiculous API) Project which demonstrates common API vulnerabilities.

name: OWASP Frankfurt #61
description:
Hi all, after the [German OWASP Day 2023](https://god.owasp.de/2023/) we want to dive into our regular OWASP Frankfurt Chapter meetings again. We are delighted to host the next in-person event in Frankfurt! For this event, we will have a range of interesting talks delivered by leaders within AppSec & Cyber Security. There will also be plenty of time to socialize before and after the event at the venue.

We're looking forward to seeing you for this in-person event!

name: [on-prem] Rust: Eine moderne Alternative zu C und C++
description:
Moin / Hi,

next talk will be in German.

Wir haben in zwei Wochen einen interessanten Vortrag von Damian Poddebniak zur gehypten Programmiersprache Rust. Dem können wir uns natürlich nicht verschließen ;-) und freuen uns auf die Einsichten von Damian!

Wir sind zu Gast bei Check24 am Anfang der Außenalster (Nähe Hotel Atlantic) In Fußmarschentfernung vom Hauptbahnhof.

Aus planungstechnischen Gründen unseres Hosts sag mir bitte per Mail oder hier bei Meetup Bescheid, wenn du dazustoßen möchtest.

Geplant ist, den Vortrag auch zu streamen. In dem Fall bitte NICHT auf "RSVP: ja" drücken, da das sonst die Planung unseres Gastgebers durcheinander bringt (Stream-URL folgt)

**TL;DR**
===

Titel: "[on-prem] Rust: Eine moderne Alternative zu C und C++ "
Sprecher: Damian Poddebniak
Lokation: Check24, An der Alster 64, 20099 Hamburg
Start: 6.7.2023, 18:30 Uhr, Einlass ab 18 Uhr
Networking danach: TBD

**Abstract**
===

C und C++ haben sich durch ihre hohe Leistung und Kontrolle über Hardware als wichtigste systemnahe Programmiersprachen etabliert. Allerdings sind sie auch bekannt für ihre subtil schwierige Anwendung und die damit verbundenen Sicherheitslücken.

Rust tritt hier als vielversprechende Alternative auf: Es bietet die gleichen Vorteile in Bezug auf Leistung und Kontrolle, bringt jedoch auch Speichersicherheit und Threadsicherheit mit. Zudem löst es weitere gesamte Klassen an Fehlern wie z.B. NULL-Pointer-Dereferenzierung auf.

Rust ist bereits jetzt fester Bestandteil des Linux- und Windows-Kernels und wird für neue Komponenten in Android eingesetzt.

Die Kombination aus Leistung, Sicherheit und nicht zuletzt einer tollen Community mit hohen sozialen Standards macht Rust zur Sprache der Wahl für moderne Programmierung.

Der Vortrag gibt einen kurzen Überblick über die Programmiersprache Rust und soll zum Auszuprobieren anregen. Dazu gibt es einen größeren Live-Coding Anteil um zu zeigen wie die Arbeit mit Rust aussieht und welche Konzepte die Sprache so besonders machen.

**Generelles zum OWASP-Stammtisch**
===

Bei unseren offenen Treffen geht es um Software und deren Sicherheit im Internet und/oder IT-Security allgemein. Es treffen sich Leute, die sich beruflich oder privat damit auseinandersetzen: Entwickler, Manager, "Pentester" und alle an (Web)sicherheit interessierte. Die Atmosphäre ist offen und locker. Uns geht's um den Erfahrungsaustausch, Technikschnack und ums Netzwerken. Wer Produkte oder Dienstleistungen verkaufen will, ist hier falsch. Ihr seid herzlich willkommen Kollegen oder Bekannte den Hinweis auf unser Treffen weiterzuleiten. Alle Treffen sind frei, für jeden offen und kostenlos.

Schönen Gruß, Björn / Dirk

name: OWASP Monthly meeting
description: The OWASP Foundation came online on December 1st, 2001 it was established as a not-for-profit charitable organization in the United States on April 21, 2004, to ensure the ongoing availability and support for our work at OWASP. OWASP is an international organization and the OWASP Foundation supports OWASP efforts around the world. OWASP is an open community dedicated to enabling organizations to conceive, develop, acquire, operate, and maintain applications that can be trusted. All of the OWASP tools, documents, forums, and chapters are free and open to anyone interested in improving application security. We advocate approaching application security as a people, process, and technology problem because the most effective approaches to application security include improvements in all of these areas. We can be found at www.owasp.org.

name: OWASP Kathmandu Meetup - 0x04
description:
The 0x04 Meetup for OWASP Kathmandu is ecstatically set to take place on the 8th of July, 2023. We are deeply honored to have the illustrious TechKraft Inc. as our esteemed sponsor.

Talks will encompass a diverse range of topics including Organizational Cybersecurity, Bug Bounties, Network Security, Compliance, and much more. Please note that this time we have implemented a strict RSVP policy, so ensure to confirm your attendance in advance.

name: OWASP Community Day
description:
**OWASP Community Day Lahore**

Join us for the highly anticipated OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) Community Day in Lahore! This event is a gathering of cybersecurity enthusiasts, professionals, students, and experts who are passionate about web application security and its importance in today's digital landscape.

During this day-long event, you will have the opportunity to engage with like-minded individuals, learn from industry leaders, and expand your knowledge in the field of web application security. The OWASP Community Day Lahore aims to promote collaboration, knowledge sharing, and awareness of the latest trends and best practices in securing web applications.

_**Highlights of the OWASP Community Day Lahore:_**

1. Expert Talks: Listen to renowned cybersecurity experts and thought leaders as they share their insights and experiences in web application security. Gain valuable knowledge about emerging threats, vulnerabilities, and effective countermeasures.

2. Hands-on Workshops: Participate in interactive workshops conducted by industry professionals where you can enhance your practical skills in areas such as secure coding, penetration testing, threat modeling, and secure software development.

3. Networking Opportunities: Connect with fellow cybersecurity enthusiasts, professionals, and students in a collaborative and engaging environment. Expand your professional network, share ideas, and forge valuable connections with individuals who share your passion for web application security.

4. Capture The Flag (CTF) Challenges: Test your skills and compete in exciting Capture The Flag challenges designed to simulate real-world scenarios. Solve security puzzles, find vulnerabilities, and demonstrate your expertise to win attractive prizes.

5. Lightning Talks and Demos: Engage in quick-paced lightning talks and live demonstrations, where participants showcase innovative tools, techniques, and research findings related to web application security. Discover new solutions and gain inspiration from cutting-edge projects.

6. Community Projects and Initiatives: Learn about ongoing OWASP projects and initiatives, and find out how you can contribute to the community. Explore opportunities to collaborate on open-source security tools, research papers, and resources that benefit the broader cybersecurity ecosystem.

Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to be part of the OWASP Community Day Lahore! Mark your calendars and join us for a day filled with knowledge sharing, skill-building, and networking in the vibrant world of web application security. Together, let's make the web a safer place for everyone.

**Note: Please stay tuned for updates on speakers, workshops, and additional event details on our official website and social media channels.**

We look forward to welcoming you to the OWASP Community Day Lahore!

name: OWASP LA Monthly In-Person Meeting - JUL 26, 2023
description:
**TOPIC**: Anatomy of a Breach: Dissecting Cloud Security

Join us for great networking, dinner and drinks, and see a presentation by John Heenan, Cloud Security Solutions Architect, Palo Alto Networks.

**ABSTRACT**: Cloud security presents unique challenges. As enterprises continue to move to the cloud, security practitioners face new threats and paradigms. In this session, we’ll forensically reconstruct major cloud-centric breaches and step through them, building an understanding of what happened, how it happened, and developing key takeaways to help secure our own infrastructure, especially in AWS, Azure, and GCP.

**SPONSORSHIP Opportunities Available**
*Vendors interested in sponsoring please send an email to sponsorship.la@owasp.org*

**CODE OF CONDUCT**
We hope you enjoy the event, we care deeply about inclusivity and diversity so that OWASP is a comfortable and welcoming community for everyone. Please reach out to one of our chapter leaders if you have any feedback/concerns or would like to speak to us, we take these matters very seriously. You can find out more about our policies here:
[https://owasp.org/www-policy/operational/conferences-events.html#conference-and-event-anti-harassment-policy](https://owasp.org/www-policy/operational/conferences-events.html#conference-and-event-anti-harassment-policy)

We're always looking for presenters and topics for future meetings - contact John (john.dileo@owasp.org) if you have an idea for a topic, or a presentation you'd like to make.

name: OWASP New Zealand Day 2023
description:
**Important Links:**

* [Conference Website](https://appsec.org.nz/conference/)
* [Conference Registration](https://events.humanitix.com/owaspnz2023) (Humanitix)
* [Pre-Conference Training Registration](https://events.humanitix.com/owaspnz2023-training) (Humanitix) - Closes 23 June

We are proud to present the 13th OWASP New Zealand Day conference, to be held at the Auckland University of Technology (AUT) City Campus on Thursday and Friday, July 6th and 7th, 2023. OWASP New Zealand Day is a two-day conference dedicated to web and application security, with an emphasis on secure architecture and development techniques to help Kiwi developers build more secure applications. The conference is presented by the [OWASP New Zealand Chapter](https://owasp.org/www-chapter-new-zealand/) and organised by [AppSec New Zealand Incorporated](https://appsec.org.nz/).

There will be two presentation streams throughout the conference. The first stream will include introductory talks on application and information security topics, as well as on policy, compliance, and risk management. The second stream will primarily address deeper technical topics. Talks featuring OWASP projects and tools are particularly encouraged, as are talks by members of under-represented communities.

In addition to these principal streams, there will be a third, smaller “stream,” supporting sponsor presentations, demos of OWASP tools, and interest/user group meetings. Diamond, Platinum, and Gold Sponsors will be given priority for time slots in this “stream.” Further details will be published closer to the date, regarding opportunities for other groups to present.

Who is the Conference for?

* Web Developers
* Security Professionals and Enthusiasts
* Program and Project Managers
* Business Analysts
* Requirements Analysts
* Software Testers

name: OWASP x LHS
description:
We are super excited to announce the first joint meetup between OWASP Newcastle and North East Ladies Hacking Society.

We will be announcing speakers imminently, however you can be sure we have great speakers lined up, along with pizza and refreshments.

Event start time from 1800 - Arrival and networking

Talk overviews:
Talk 1
**Title:** tbc
**Speaker:** Katie McMillan
**Speaker Bio:** Katie is a Cybersecurity enthusiast, strategist and an advocate for Women in Technology. Katie was one of the winners of TechWomen100 in 2021.
**Talk Synopsis:** tbc

Talk 2
**Title:** Look at me! I'm the manager now: Becoming a Security Engineer Manager, common pitfalls, lessons and more.
**Speaker:** Marcus Tenorio
**Speaker Bio:** Marcus Tenorio, A.K.A MART
He is a Brazilian who didn't cost 40 million and has been working with security in recent years from research projects, to small hacks, to the pleasure of managing a team of security engineers and software engineers.
**Talk Synopsis:** This session dives into transitioning from a security engineer to a security engineering manager, addressing common pitfalls, valuable lessons, and critical errors to avoid. We will have some insights into the challenges faced during this transition and learn practical strategies to overcome them. The talk emphasizes the importance of effective communication, stakeholder management, and cultivating a collaborative team culture by sharing real-world examples and providing guidance on navigating potential errors (that I did, again oh dear so many)

As always, tickets aren’t required but help us gauge how much food to order.

**Live Stream Info:** We're hoping to be able to live stream the event on the OWASP Newcastle [playeur channel](https://playeur.com/c/OWASPNewcastle/) if not, the talks will be recorded and uploaded there.

You can also join the OWASP Newcastle Google Group which is how we'll be sending out emails to events and is also going to be used as a forum for discussion.

https://groups.google.com/a/owasp.org/forum/#!forum/newcastle-chapter

name: Mobile Rules the World - Jump into Mobile AppSec with the OWASP MAS Project
description: Mobile apps dominate all digital time spent online - but mobile AppSec programs often lag. Jumpstart your team and skills by stepping inside the OWASP Mobile AppSec Project (MAS) to learn about the fundamentals of mobile app security and the latest updates just released in OWASP MASVS V2 launched at OWASP Global AppSec in Dublin. Learn the differences in mobile AppSec vs. web AppSec and how to put OWASP MAS project, tools, and resources to work. In this session, we will drill down into the top 5 most frequent security issues found in testing thousands of mobile apps. Learn how to test for them and how to teach your dev teams to prevent them with code examples, test examples, links to additional resources, and how to build your own toolkit. Along the way, we will hit the latest privacy and security updates with iOS and Android. The Web Rocks… but Mobile Rules - Come join us!

name: Chapter 2: OWASP Meet Up
description:
**OWASP JULY!**
We're back for our 2nd Cyber catch up! July's focus is on cloud security, trends and behaviours.

**Who is it for?**
Everybody! Come along, bring a friend, share with your colleagues.
A principle of the chapter is to ensure **cyber security is accessible** for everyone. You don't need to be a security professional, each session will break down topics to ensure everybody can take something away.

**Agenda**

* **Xavi Garcia** & **David Greenwood** (of Prisma Security origin) share their insights into cloud security trends and behaviours.
* **Ashley Fleet** hosts a round-table discussing the latest cyber trends (think AI, secure coding, recent breaches)
* **Networking & Drinks**

**When is it?**

* Wednesday 5th July
* **Start** from 7:30pm
* **Finish** around 11:00pm

**Where is it?**

* The Brewery Tap, Peterborough

**How can you get involved?**

* Respond **'I'm coming!'** to this group
* Check out our OWASP Chapter [page](https://owasp.org/www-chapter-peterborough/)

We look forward to seeing you there!

name: Security Social Lunch Hours
description:
At noon on the 2nd Wednesday of every month we host a social meeting on Zoom with mini talks and breakout rooms. The main room will always be open for social time but we plan to have 1-2 topic breakouts you can join. If the breakout session topic interests you, join that discussion. Feeling more like a casual chat and exploring other topics? Visit the main room to strike up a conversation.

Suggest topics you’d like to see breakout rooms for and let us know if you’d like to sign up to lead one.

Slack @ #chapter-seattle (https://bit.ly/owasp-seattle-slack)

seattle-chapter@owasp.org (https://groups.google.com/a/owasp.org/g/seattle-chapter)

name: Residential Proxies Unmasked: Navigating the Hidden Threat
description:
Join us at the second OWASP Sydney event featuring a talk by [Adam Cassar](https://www.linkedin.com/in/adamcassarac/) from [Peakhour.io](http://peakhour.io/) who will delve into the world of residential proxies. In this talk, Adam will dive into residential proxies, tools that allow for requests from residential IP addresses. He'll clarify what these proxies are, who relies on them, and the possibilities they unlock. Additionally, he'll go over the process of how these large-scale proxy networks come to life.

Adam will discuss the potential implications of these services on IP threat intelligence, the complications of carrier-grade NAT, and questions our reliance on geo-IP databases. He'll also shed light on how your internet use at home, school, or work might be effected by these services.

Finally, Adam will touch on ongoing legal cases involving these services and reveal that some state actors are setting up their own proxy networks for data extraction purposes. The goal is to equip you with a comprehensive understanding of residential proxies, enabling you to make informed decisions within the field of internet security.

**Here are the details of the event:**
**Date:** July 11th 2023, 5:30pm
**Venue**: Talenza, Level 3, Macquarie Place, Sydney

**Schedule:**

* 5.30 pm: Arrive, grab a drink, and meet your fellow attendees.
* 6.00 pm: Residential Proxies Talk.
* 6:30 pm: Q&A.
* 7:00 pm: Networking.

* 8:00 pm: Event ends

RSVP now, and we'll see you there!

Best regards,
OWASP Sydney Chapter Committee

name: OWASP Vancouver - July 2023
